0: “Failing to plan is planning to fail” ~ Alan Lakein
1: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.” ~ Walt Disney
2: “Plans are nothing; planning is everything.” ~ Dwight D. Eisenhower
3: “If you’re going through hell, keep going.” ~ Winston Churchill
4: “Learning never exhausts the mind.” ~ Leonardo da Vinci
5: “Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.” ~ Sigmund Freud
6: “Remember that failure is an event, not a person.” ~ Zig Ziglar
7: “There is no substitute for hard work.” ~ Thomas A. Edison
8: “Improved productivity means less human sweat, not more.” ~ Henry Ford
9: “Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.” ~ Peter Drucker
10: “Why do anything unless it is going to be great?” ~ Peter Block
11: “Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.” ~ David Allen
12: “Focus on being productive instead of busy.” ~ Tim Ferriss
13: “He that rises late must trot all day.” ~ Benjamin Franklin
14: “Efficiency is doing better what is already being done.” ~ Peter Drucker
15: “We have a strategic plan. It’s called doing things.” ~ Herb Kelleher
16: “Don’t confuse the urgent with the important.” ~ Preston Ni
17: “You may delay, but time will not.” ~ Benjamin Franklin
18: “Long-range planning works best in the short term.” ~ Doug Evelyn
19: “Action is the foundational key to all success.” ~ Picasso
20: “Never mistake motion for action.” ~ Ernest Hemingway
21: “The noblest search is the search for excellence.” ~ Lyndon B. Johnson
22: “Happen to things, don't let things happen to you.” ~ Stephen Covey
23: “A worker without genius is better than a genius who won't work.” ~ Leopold Auer
24: “Create with the heart; build with the mind.” ~ Criss Jami
25: “If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.” ~ Benjamin Franklin
26: “Make each day your masterpiece.” ~ John Wooden
27: “Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.” ~ Albert Einstein
28: “It's hard to beat a person who never gives up.” ~ Babe Ruth
29: “You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.” ~ Wayne Gretzky
30: “The art of communication is the language of leadership.” ~ James Humes
31: “Eloquence is a painting of the thoughts.” ~ Blaise Pascal
32: “First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.” ~ Epictetus
33: “The temple of art is built in words.” ~ Josiah Gilbert Holland
34: “Brevity is the soul of wit.” ~ William Shakespeare
35: “It's communication - that's what theatre is all about.” ~ Chita Rivera
36: “A man who does not plan long ahead will find trouble at his door.” ~ Confucius
39: “A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.” ~ Geoge S. Patton
40: “Plan your work and work your plan.” ~ Napoleon Hill
41: “Dreaming after all, is a form of planning.” ~ Gloria Steinem
42: “Chance favors the prepared mind.” ~ Louis Pasteur
43: “It is a bad plan that admits of no modification.” ~ Publilius Syrus
44: “You must plan to be spontaneous.” ~ David Hockney
